intro: Dodecatheon pauciflorum var. watsonii, commonly known as Watson's glory-of-the-snow, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often hairy, while its stems are slender and branched. This variety is distinguished by its reduced flower count compared to the typical form of Dodecatheon pauciflorum.
